availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob B. Ehrich (Louisville, Ky, Police Dept; "always wore a silk hat")

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, police department clerk and chief of police. Kentucky native. Assistant chief of police in 1856 and 1862. Chief of police in Louisville in 1858. Clerk in the police department in Louisville, Kentucky, from 1860 to 1864.

ab.bibl:
“Died in St. Louis: Tribute to Jacob B. Ehrich, an Old Time Citizen of Louisville,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), July 18, 1897, p. A8.
Henry Tanner, ed., Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 81.
Morton O. Childress, Louisville Division of Police: History and Personnel (Louisville, KY: Turner Publishing Co., 2005), 35.
